description.narrative: 4.1 National and subnational government and civil society advance and monitor child rights for most deprived children, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Sri Lanka, including the most deprived, have their human rights protected and benefit from effective child-sensitive social protection system.

sector.narrative: CRC, CEDAW or CRPD - follow up on concluding observations
Independent national child rights institution / ombudsperson

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1 National and subnational government and civil society advance and monitor child rights for most deprived children

description.narrative: An online indicator matrix based on the 2018 concluding observations to streamline internal Government monitoring for the implementation of and reporting on the CRC recommendations has been populated with data. The Ministry of Women and Child Affairs is in the process of conducting training programmes for relevant Ministries on regularly updating the matrix. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of recommendations of the CRC Concluding Observations 2018 raised by UNICEF through its advocacy work

actual.value: 2019:The government has developed a matrix based on the 2018 concluding observations and continues to track the progress

title.narrative: National independent coordinating mechanism responsible for overseeing the implementation of international treaty body recommendations on child rights is in place

actual.value: 2019:Committee is functioning and decentralized to the provincial level
